p: Basing on the frequency of citation, the most cited medicinal plant species to manage thyroid disorders were Atriplex halimus L. (FC = 32), Bunium incrassatum (Boiss.) Amo (FC = 30) and Nigella sativa L. (CF = 14). Atriplex halimus L. and Bunium incrassatum (Boiss.) Amo particularly are used for treating both hyperthyroidism and hypothyroidism, although their effects are poorly understood. To the knowledge of authors, there is no published work describing the use of Atriplex halimus L. and Bunium incrassatum (Boiss.) Batt. & Trab. for the treatment of thyroid disorders.
